Description: Financial reporting definition (Finance). Groups G/L accounts and calculations into lines/columns for analysis and KPI charts; pulls from G/L entries and budgets. Schedules are design objects, not posted documents.

Aggregated dimension analysis snapshot (Finance). Pre-processed grouping of G/L (and sometimes item) entries by up to 4 selected dimensions to speed reporting. Must be updated; differs from on-the-fly filters.

Item application workspace (Inventory/Costing). Page to review and reapply item ledger entry matches (fixed or incorrect) before corrective posting. Filter by item/location/document; editable staging, not a ledger or journal.
Bill of materials for assembly (Manufacturing/Assembly). Lists required components/resources for an assembly item; simpler than production BOM (no routing). Static definition, not transactional.
Executable assembly document (Assembly). Controls consumption of components and output of assembled item; can handle partial postings. Simpler flow than production order.
Fulfilment method (Assembly/Sales). Configuration where assembly is triggered by a sales order line; components reserved; supports late configuration. Not same as make-to-order production.
Master record (Finance/Cash Mgmt). Represents a company bank ledger; used for payments, reconciliation, cash flow. Keep abbreviation; singular header even in lists.

Process document (Finance/Cash Mgmt). Page for matching bank statement lines to Bank Account Ledger Entries and posting differences. Distinct from Bank Reconciliation = broader process; this is the specific page/document.
Inventory valuation method (Inventory/Costing). Calculates moving weighted average per item (and location/variant if configured). Affects cost flow assumptions; not a document.
Mass posting action (General). Function to post multiple documents (e.g., invoices, orders) in one run. Staging unaffected; ensures consistency and efficiency.
Warehouse quantity snapshot (Warehouse). Record showing quantity, characteristics of an item (variant, lot, serial) in a specific bin. Not a ledger entry; reflects current state.
External bank statement document (Finance). Imported or entered statement detailing bank transactions for reconciliation. Differs from internal Bank Ledger entries.
Document (Finance/Cash Mgmt). Groups posted entries (e.g., payments, receipts) into a deposit for bank reconciliation; may create Bank Account Ledger Entries when posted.
Process/workspace (Finance). Matching and adjusting between bank statement lines and bank ledger entries. Produces adjustments; not the external statement itself.
Framework purchasing agreement (Purchasing). Long-term order capturing expected multiple releases over time; releases become standard purchase orders. Not posted directly.
Framework sales agreement (Sales). Captures customer commitments for multiple future shipments; releases create sales orders. Not directly shipped/invoiced.
Dimension used in budgets (Finance). Dimension value axis applied to Budget Entries distinct from standard G/L budget dimensions; controls slicing of budget figures.
Record of planned amounts (Finance). Represents budgeted amounts per G/L account (and dimensions) stored separately from posted entries; used in comparisons.
Status flag state (Inventory). Item marked blocked to prevent transactions (purchase, sales, consumption) while retaining historical entries. Not a separate object.
Projection model (Finance/Cash Flow). Aggregates expected cash inflows/outflows from documents, budgets, and manual adjustments for planning liquidity.
Staging worksheet (Finance/Cash Flow). Collects projected cash movements from source areas (sales, purchase, service, FA, manual) before generating Cash Flow Forecast; editable planning workspace.
Routing resource (Manufacturing). Work/Machine center flagged limited so planning splits/levels load; influences scheduling and finite capacity algorithms.
Posted capacity usage record (Manufacturing). Immutable history of time (setup/run/wait) consumed by work or machine center operations for costing and analysis.
Calculated required capacity (Manufacturing). Sum of setup + run (adjusted for scrap and lot sizing) for a production operation; used to compare against available capacity.
Process (Manufacturing). Balances required vs available capacity across work/machine centers using routings, calendars, constraints; drives rescheduling suggestions.
Structured list (Finance). Hierarchical set of G/L Accounts used for classification and reporting; basis for posting and financial statements.
Posted check transaction (Finance). Record of issued, voided, or applied checks; links to related vendor/customer entries; immutable audit trail.
AL object type (Development). Encapsulates procedures/functions for business logic; no UI; referenced by events, pages, reports. Keep noun form; not translated.
Cost accounting setup (Cost Accounting). Defines source and target distribution rules to spread costs (e.g., overhead) across cost centers/objects.
Planned cost amounts (Cost Accounting). Budgeted figures per Cost Type/Center/Object for comparison and allocations; separate from G/L budget.
Journal (Manufacturing). Staging for manual posting of component consumption against production/assembly orders; editable until posted to item/value entries.
Audit log (Service). Captures changes to service contract fields (pricing, coverage) for traceability; not editable.
Dimension in Cost Accounting. Organizational responsibility area receiving allocated and direct costs; distinct from Cost Object (output focus).
Journal (Cost Accounting). Staging to post cost entries (allocations, corrections) into cost accounting ledger; parallels but separate from G/L journals.
Dimension in Cost Accounting. Entity (product, project, activity) to which costs are ultimately assigned; contrasts with Cost Center (responsibility origin).
Master (Cost Accounting). Classification similar to G/L Account in cost ledger; defines nature of cost for budgeting, allocation, analysis.
Posting group (Sales/Finance). Maps customer transactions to G/L accounts (receivables, discounts, prepayments); part of combined posting logic with Gen. Bus./Prod.
Configuration (Integration). Mapping schema to import/export structured files (XML/CSV/JSON) into staging tables; defines elements, transformations, validations.
Pricing grouping (Sales). Assigns customers to shared price/discount agreements; used in price list evaluation; distinct from Campaign or Customer Disc. Group.
Template (Finance/Revenue Recognition). Defines schedule pattern for automatic deferral of revenue/expense across periods when posting documents.
Planned demand (Manufacturing/Supply). Entered or imported quantity expectations per item/date; feeds planning (MRP/MPS) distinct from orders.
Generated schedule (Finance). Resulting dated entries created from a Deferral Template for a specific posted document line; controls recognition timing.
Fixed asset configuration set (Fixed Assets). Holds rules and integration flags per FA (posting to G/L, tax, internal); multiple books per asset allowed.
Rule (Fixed Assets). Algorithm (SL, DB, user-defined) determining periodic depreciation calculation for a Depreciation Book.
Analytical attribute (Cross-module). User-defined classification (e.g., Department) applied to entries for slicing; differs from fields like Location; used in Analysis Views.
Validation rule (Dimensions). Permitted or blocked pairing of two dimensions to enforce data entry consistency; prevents invalid analysis combos.
Unique combination identifier (Dimensions). Hash/key representing a specific set of Dimension Value pairs reused on entries for storage efficiency.
Component record (Dimensions). Links a single Dimension + Value to a Dimension Set; collection forms the Dimension Set.
Member (Dimensions). Specific value within a Dimension (e.g., DEPT=SALES); can be hierarchical; used on master data, journals, documents.
Digital structured document (Sales/Purchase/Service). Electronic version (EDI/PEPPOL etc.) of business documents for transmission; supports statuses (in progress, sent). Not a printed report.
Obsolete alias (Fixed Assets). Legacy naming for Depreciation Book associated with fixed asset; prefer Depreciation Book description above.
Costing component (Inventory/Costing). Portion of item cost directly attributable (materials, purchased cost) excluding indirect/overhead; influences margin calculations.
Fulfillment method (Sales/Purchase). Vendor ships directly to customer; sales order line linked to purchase order; no inventory receipt/shipment posted in between.
Journal (Fixed Assets). Staging for FA transactions (acquisition, depreciation, disposal, write-down, appreciation, maintenance) prior to posting to FA Ledger and G/L.
System-generated sequence number (Various ledgers). Unique key identifying a posted ledger entry; immutable; used for audit linkage.
Supplemental description (Cross-module). Predefined multiline text blocks insertable onto document lines; not part of master item description.
Posted fixed asset transaction (Fixed Assets). Immutable record (acquisition, depreciation, disposal etc.) affecting asset value and book; separate from G/L entry though linked.
Classification (Fixed Assets). Enumerated type (Acquisition, Depreciation, Write-Down, Appreciation, Disposal, Maintenance) determining FA ledger treatment.
Context pane part (UI). Page part showing related info, KPIs, validation messages; read-only; translates as UI element name, keep casing.
Document (Finance/AR). Issued to customer for interest/late payment fees based on overdue entries; similar lifecycle to reminders but for finance charges.
Master record (Fixed Assets). Represents tangible or intangible asset tracked for depreciation and maintenance; holds books, posting groups, acquisition data.
Production order status (Manufacturing). Order with quantity and components fixed but still adjustable before release; used for planning stability.
Recurring or general fixed asset journal (Fixed Assets). Variant of FA Journal for repeated or periodic postings; staging before posting.
Master record (Finance). Node in Chart of Accounts accumulating posted G/L Entries; referenced by posting groups; may allow direct posting.
Budget dataset (Finance). Set of planned amounts by period and account (and dimensions) stored separately for comparison to actual; multiple named budgets supported.
Planning inclusion control (Manufacturing). Date cut-off or quantity portion of Demand Forecast to include when generating supply plan; not a document.
Record (Demand Forecast). Single item/date/quantity line representing expected demand; feeds planning suggestions.
Posted financial transaction line (Finance). Immutable record with account, amounts, dimensions; forms audit trail; produced by posting routines.
Journal (Finance). Staging for direct general ledger postings (adjustments, accruals) outside subledger documents; posts to G/L Entries.
Business dimension posting group (Finance). Classifies customer/vendor side for mapping to revenue, COGS, VAT accounts with Gen. Prod. Posting Group.
Product dimension posting group (Finance). Classifies item/resource/service side for mapping to G/L (sales, COGS, inventory, VAT) combined with Gen. Bus. Posting Group.
Entry journal (Finance). Generic journal template/batch combination allowing varied line types (G/L, customer, vendor, bank) for posting to multiple ledgers.
Primary accounting ledger (Finance). Aggregation of G/L Entries by account; basis for financial statements; distinct from subledgers (customer, vendor, item).
Inbound intercompany transaction placeholder (Intercompany). Received document header awaiting acceptance/processing into local documents.
Outbound intercompany transaction record (Intercompany). Pending or sent transaction representing documents to partner companies.
Journal (Intercompany). Staging for cross-company balancing entries routed to partners; generates IC Outbox lines.
Master (Intercompany). Defines related company (internal/external) codes, mapping, and accounts used for IC transactions.
Logistic movement (Inventory/Warehouse). Transfer order leg representing goods en route inbound to a location; used for availability planning.
Costing component (Inventory/Costing). Overhead percentage or amount added to Direct Cost to form unit cost; applied via item or setup.
Generic IC record (Intercompany). Represents a transfer of value between partners; umbrella term for specific IC documents.
Mapping group (Inventory/Finance). Links items/SKUs to inventory, WIP, COGS accounts; works with Gen. Prod./Bus. Posting Groups.
Costing process/report (Inventory/Costing). Determines current inventory value including applied item charges and adjustments; not a ledger itself.
Master record (Inventory). Represents sellable/purchasable/consumable product or resource tracked for quantity, cost, availability.
Link record (Inventory Costing). Specifies matching between inbound and outbound Item Ledger Entries for cost flow (applies, adjustments).
Additional cost concept (Inventory). Represents landed or ancillary cost allocated to items via Item Charge Assignment to adjust valuation.
Allocation definition (Inventory). Mapping distributing Item Charge amounts across receipt or shipment lines; affects item cost.
Journal (Inventory). Staging for adjustments, transfers, positive/negative adjustments, reclassifications; posts to Item/Value Entries.
Posted inventory transaction (Inventory). Immutable record of quantity change (inbound/outbound) with cost; basis for valuation.
Feature (Inventory Traceability). Serial/lot/package tracking enabling trace, reservation, specific costing; managed via Item Tracking Lines.
Project master (Jobs). Controls task structure, budgets, WIP, recognition for long-term projects distinct from production orders.
Journal (Jobs). Staging for usage, resource, item, and G/L cost postings against job tasks prior to creating job ledger entries.
Detail entry (Inventory Tracking). Captures serial/lot/package allocation for a document or journal line; drives reservations and cost specificity.
Alternate specification (Inventory). Variation of an Item (size/color/etc.) sharing base master but separate planning and availability attributes.
Budget/schedule line (Jobs). Defines estimated usage or sales for job tasks; can create Job Journal lines; separated by line type.
Background scheduler (System). Executes scheduled tasks/codeunits per defined recurrence; supports categories and dependencies.
Classification (System). Groups job queue entries for prioritization and resource allocation; influences run ordering.
Scheduled execution record (System). Defines object to run, parameters, recurrence, status for job queue processing.
History (System). Logged outcome (success/failure) of job queue entry executions for diagnostics.
Work breakdown element (Jobs). Hierarchical segment under a Job used to aggregate costs, billings, progress.
Batch (Journals). Container (Name) within a Journal Template controlling numbering, posting settings, approvals.
Template (Journals). Defines journal type behavior (General, Item, FA) and default controls; batches inherit settings.
Generic posted record term. Any immutable entry line (G/L, Customer, Item, VAT, etc.). Avoid translating; use specific ledger term when possible.
Inventory site (Inventory/Warehouse). Physical or logical place with its own stock, bins, and policies; affects planning and costing.
Tracking identifier (Inventory). Batch number grouping multiple units with common characteristics; required for lot-tracked items.
Capacity resource (Manufacturing). Single machine unit for routing operations; provides capacity, calendar, costs distinct from Work Center.
Calculated component demand (Manufacturing). Needed component quantities per production order; basis for picking/issue.
MRP/MPS workspace (Supply Planning). Staging page for system-generated supply suggestions (orders, transfers) before creation.
Availability schedule (Manufacturing). Working/non-working shifts for a Machine Center; drives capacity calculation.
Load view (Manufacturing). Visual/quantitative representation of required vs available capacity for a Machine Center.
Operation list (Manufacturing). Sequenced tasks assigned to a Machine Center for execution scheduling.
KPI summary (Manufacturing). Aggregated metrics (utilization, efficiency, variance) for Machine Center performance.
Configuration (Manufacturing). Global parameters (locations, flushing, cost calc, lead times) influencing production planning and posting.
Accounting date (Finance). Date used for ledger posting and period determination; may differ from document date.
Inventory decrease entry type (Inventory). Manual or system-generated outbound quantity correcting stock; posted through Item Journal or processes.
Cost category with no quantity (Inventory Valuation). Value entry component for non-inventoriable amounts affecting item cost analysis.
Journal (Manufacturing). Staging for reporting finished output quantities and time consumption; posts Item and Capacity entries.
Logistic movement (Inventory). Goods in transit out of a location on a transfer order; affects availability until receipt.
Generic mapping concept (Finance). Links master or transactions to G/L accounts (customer, vendor, inventory, VAT); specify subtype for clarity.
Pricing definition (Sales/Purchase). Structured price/discount set with validity, currency, dimensions; supersedes older price models.
Bill of materials (Manufacturing). Structured list of components for production (supports versions, phantom, scrap factors). Distinct from Assembly BOM (simpler).
Historical record (Assembly). Resulting posted header capturing output and consumption from an Assembly Order; immutable.
Posted vendor invoice (Purchasing). Final document creating vendor ledger and G/L entries; corrections via Credit Memo.
Posted receipt document (Purchasing). Confirms physical receipt; may precede invoicing; creates Item Ledger Entries.
Posted customer invoice (Sales). Final sales billing document creating customer and G/L entries; corrected via Sales Credit Memo.
Posted shipment document (Sales). Confirms goods shipped; may precede invoicing; creates Item Ledger Entries.
Manufacturing order (Manufacturing). Controls material consumption and output with statuses (Planned, Firm Planned, Released, Finished).
Document (Purchasing). Reverses or adjusts posted purchase invoice amounts; creates corrective ledger entries.
Document (Purchasing). Vendor billing prior to posting; upon posting becomes Posted Purchase Invoice.
Anticipated production demand dataset (Manufacturing). Time-phased item quantities (sales/component) feeding planning suggestions.
Journal (Manufacturing). Used to post consumption and output for production orders in one entry; alternative to separate journals.
Line (Manufacturing). Component requirement line on production order; drives picking and consumption posting.
Header detail line (Manufacturing). Defines item and quantity produced within multi-line production order scenario.
Operational sequence (Manufacturing). Routing operations attached to production order controlling scheduling and capacity posting.
Pricing element (Purchasing). Setup or calculated discount applied to purchase line based on item, vendor, quantity, date; reduces line cost before posting.
Commitment document (Purchasing). Authorizes vendor supply; supports partial receipts/invoicing; central to planning demand.
Pricing record (Purchasing). Condition-based unit cost entries (vendor, item, variant, quantity, currency, dates) used in price determination.
Pre-commitment document (Purchasing). Request/offer stage; can be converted to Purchase Order; no ledger posting.
Process/document (Purchasing). Receipt posting that updates inventory and creates Posted Purchase Receipt; may precede invoice.
Return process document (Purchasing). Manages returning goods/services to vendor; can create Return Shipment and Credit Memo.
Planning parameter (Inventory Planning). Defines lot sizing algorithm (Fixed Order Qty., Lot-for-Lot, Maximum Qty., Order, etc.) influencing replenishment suggestions.
Design definition (Reporting). Custom or built-in layout (RDLC, Word, Excel) used to format report output separate from data set.
Warehouse planning worksheet (Warehouse). Optimizes distribution of received items into bins before creating Put-away documents.
Attribute metric (Manufacturing/Quality). Defined measurement (e.g., length, weight) used in routing or inspection; referenced by operations.
Scheduling weight (System/Job Queue). Numeric priority influencing execution order of job queue entries within category.
Planning method field (Inventory). Defines supply source (Purchase, Transfer, Prod. Order, Assembly) for item/SKU; drives suggestion type.
Link record (Availability). System-generated record tying supply to demand (orders, journals) to guarantee quantity/lot/serial assignment.
Organizational unit (Multi-site). Defines location-based responsibility for sales, purchase, service processing and defaults.
Capacity or billed entity (Jobs/Service). Represents person or machine for time usage and billing; distinct from Item (inventory).
Grouping (Jobs/Service). Aggregates Resources with similar skills/capacity for planning and assignment.
Posted inbound return document (Sales Returns). Confirms receipt of returned goods from customer; updates inventory and customer ledger.
Posted outbound return document (Purchase Returns). Confirms shipment of goods back to vendor; updates inventory and vendor ledger.
Available time measure (Jobs/Service). Defines quantity of resource availability per period for scheduling; considers calendars.
Journal (Resources). Staging for usage entries (time/cost) to post Resource Ledger Entries and job/service costs.
Posted resource usage/cost record (Resources). Immutable ledger line for resource consumption or sales; includes cost, price, dimensions.
Capability qualifier (Service). Tagged competencies associated with Resources and Service Items for assignment filtering.
VAT mechanism (Tax). Indicates transactions where VAT liability shifts to customer; affects VAT Posting Groups and reporting.
Journal (Inventory Valuation). Staging to adjust item cost (unit cost, valuation) retroactively; posts Value Entries.
Home workspace (UI). Personalized page aggregating KPIs, cues, tasks for a user role; entry point to processes.
Definition (Manufacturing). Standard sequence of operations (work/machine centers) producing an item; includes times, tools, scrap factors.
Process/report (Inventory Valuation). Execution of revaluation entries posting adjustments to value and G/L.
Synchronization code (Manufacturing). Links BOM components to routing operations for just-in-time consumption flushing.
Planning buffer (Inventory). Minimum desired on-hand to cover variability; drives replenishment suggestions when projected below.
Document (Sales). Reverses or adjusts posted Sales Invoice amounts (quantity, price); creates corrective ledger entries.
Operation line (Manufacturing). Individual step within a Routing defining center, times, scrap, overlap; basis for capacity need.
Versioned variant (Manufacturing). Alternative effective-dated routing definition for an item (engineering changes, region).
Planning buffer (Inventory Planning). Additional days added to supply lead time to mitigate delays; shifts planned receipt earlier.
Document (Sales). Billing document converting shipped or service-delivered lines into receivables; posting creates Customer and G/L entries.
Operation scrap percentage (Manufacturing). Percent used in capacity or cost calculations to inflate required input for expected loss.
Pricing element (Sales). Calculated or agreed discount reducing line amount; based on customer, item, quantity, dates, campaigns.
Commitment document (Sales). Customer order triggering reservations, planning demand, shipment, and invoicing; supports partial fulfillment.
Pricing record (Sales). Condition-based unit price entries (customer/group/campaign, item, quantity, currency, dates) used in price determination.
Pre-commitment document (Sales). Offer to customer; can convert to Sales Order; non-posting.
Return process document (Sales). Manages customer returns; leads to Return Receipt and Credit Memo; handles RMA flow.
Posted outbound shipment (Sales). Confirms goods shipped; creates Item Ledger Entries; may precede invoicing.
Component scrap factor (Manufacturing). Percentage increasing component quantity in BOM to cover expected material loss.
Tracking identifier (Inventory). Unique per unit serial number enabling trace and warranty tracking; required for serial-tracked items.
Agreement (Service). Defines coverage, period, pricing for servicing Service Items; supports periodic invoicing and change logging.
Document (Service). Reverses or adjusts posted service invoice amounts; posts corrective service and G/L entries.
Working time template (Manufacturing). Defines shifts/working days applied to Work/Machine Centers for capacity scheduling.
Exception date entry (Manufacturing). Non-working day overriding Shop Calendar default for capacity calculations.
Day definition (Manufacturing). Specifies working day pattern (hours) within Shop Calendar; base for capacity.
Master record (Service). Represents customer item under service (product installed) with warranty, skills, contract links.
Document (Service). Controls repair/maintenance tasks, allocations, parts usage, and billing for service items.
Grouping (Service Pricing). Associates standardized service pricing rules with customers or service items.
Cost component (Manufacturing). Portion of item cost attributed to outsourced operation charges; appears in value entries.
Planning worksheet (Manufacturing). Assists in managing and releasing operations or orders to subcontractors.
Pre-commitment document (Service). Proposed service work scope and pricing; convertible to Service Order; non-posting.
Process (Inventory Planning). Generation of supply suggestions (production, purchase, transfer) based on demand, policies; includes MRP/MPS logic.
Internal tracking record (Inventory). Detailed allocation of lot/serial/package for a line; ensures uniqueness and trace.
Geographical classification (Service). Region grouping for scheduling and pricing; influences assignment and travel considerations.
Posted outbound transfer document (Inventory). Records shipment leg of inter-location transfer; goods become in transit.
Posted inbound transfer document (Inventory). Records receipt leg completing transfer; updates on-hand at destination.
Fast entry dimension (Dimensions). One of two global shortcut dimensions available on many pages for quick coding; maps to underlying Dimension Set.
Abbreviation for Stockkeeping Unitâ€”see Stockkeeping Unit entry; avoid expanding when UI expects SKU.
Item-location-variant record (Inventory Planning). Granular planning master specifying replenishment parameters per combination.
Process (Manufacturing). Outsourcing specific routing operations to external vendors; impacts lead time and cost collection.
Identifier (Inventory). Code selecting an Item Variant on document or planning line; differentiates characteristics.
Inventory value/quantity correction (Warehouse). Adjustments recorded via warehouse journals to align bin quantities with physical count.
Domain term (Logistics). End-to-end flow of goods and data from procurement through distribution; context for trace and planning features.
Document (Inventory). Controls internal movement of items between locations; produces Transfer Shipment and Receipt postings.
Value Added Tax (Tax). Indirect consumption tax handled via VAT Posting Groups on transactions; abbreviation preserved.
Posted tax record (Tax). Ledger entry capturing VAT base and amount per transaction for reporting and settlement.
Mapping group (Tax). Combines VAT Bus. and VAT Prod. Posting Groups to derive VAT accounts and rates.
Reporting definition (Tax). Layout aggregating VAT Entries into boxes for return filing; can be simulated and posted.
Warehouse operation document (Warehouse). Pick/Put-away/Movement/Inventory activity lines guiding physical handling.
Posted warehouse ledger (Warehouse). Records bin-level quantity changes resulting from warehouse activities.
Internal request document (Warehouse). Pick for internal consumption or movement not tied to external shipment.
Internal put-away document (Warehouse). Places internally moved or produced goods into storage bins.
Warehouse movement document (Warehouse). Moves items between bins while preserving inventory integrity.
Journal (Warehouse). Staging to reclassify bin, lot, serial, or package assignments at warehouse level.
Journal (Warehouse). General-purpose warehouse adjustments and reclassifications for bin-level changes.
Grouping (Manufacturing). Collection of Work Centers with similar capabilities for load balancing.
Load view (Manufacturing). Required vs available capacity visualization for a Work Center over time.
Operation list (Manufacturing). Sequence of tasks assigned to Work Center for execution scheduling.
Document (Warehouse). Guided picking instructions for outbound shipments or production supply.
Document (Warehouse). Guided placement of received or produced goods into bins.
Document (Warehouse). Receives inbound purchase/transfer/production output into warehouse before put-away.
Posted register (Warehouse). Audit record of warehouse activities (pick, movement, put-away) and resulting entries.
Document (Warehouse). Consolidates outbound lines for picking and shipment posting.
Capacity resource (Manufacturing). Aggregated capacity grouping multiple machines or labor; higher-level than Machine Center.
Process automation definition (System). Configured set of events, conditions, responses controlling approval and notifications.
Component (Workflow). Single action or approval link within a Workflow defining sequence and response.
Project WIP calculation method (Jobs). Algorithm determining how costs/revenue recognized (Cost of Sales, Completed Contract, etc.).
